desc.p: This field indicates if the for the instrument in question any special kind of rounding needs to be done or not.It will have a default value as null
A vaild value is TRUNCATE.CONSID.Other options can be added in the future.
This determines the rounding method to be used for the unit interest rounding. The field UNIT.DEC.PLC sets the number of decimal places that the accrued interest will be rounded to.

tr.td: If the digit to the right of the required decimal places is greater than zero then the last required decimal will be rounded up to the next integer
If the digit to the right of the required decimal places is greater than zero then the last required decimal will be remain unchanged.

If the digit to the right of the required decimal places is less than four then the last required decimal will be remain unchanged, however, if the digit is five or greater then the last required digit will be rounded up to the next integer.

desc.p: In some domestic markets, securities trading may be carried out using different methods of rounding for day-to-day activity (trades and accruals) compared with the subsequent payment of coupons (DIARY and ENTITLEMENT). In some cases, depending upon the numbers decimals required to perform the calculations, the final day's accrual before coupon date (the coupon payment) may differ substantially from the previous days' accruals (accrued interest for the period) in the current period. The System generally passes these adjustments to an internal suspense account as defined in fields, CPN.ADJ.DR.CAT and CPN.ADJ.CR.CAT in SEC.ACC.MASTER to enable subsequent investigation. Should you wish the System to by-pass this process for these security types and instead adjust the accrual instead for the last day before coupon date so that the result goes directly to P/L, then you should set this field to "YES".
